messages.msgSnippet: Catfights of Hajime are fine by me... just as long as we all know that in the end we re going to have to share the title! And I m sure he s laughing his head
messages.messageBody:
Catfights of Hajime are fine by me... just as long as we all know that in
the end we're going to have to share the title!
And I'm sure he's laughing his head off right now. What will be more
amusing is when his fans start congregating in the afterlife... then we all
can get the *real* story. ;)

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Hellos and First Impressions.
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/9/2004 2:43:43 AM Eastern Standard Time, spiritus_saitou@*... writes: ... With two websites devoted to Saitou alone (both of which
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/9/2004 2:43:43 AM Eastern Standard Time,
spiritus_saitou@... writes:
Grace Battista <wounds@...> wrote:

>>I'm wounds the MOST LOYAL fan of Saitou-sama. <<

With two websites devoted to Saitou alone (both of which are determined to
make me bald by the end of the week with all the hair-pulling over format) and a
fic site to SaitouxSano, I think you're going to have to share that title,
wounds. :-D MOST LOYAL... (I'm sure secretarytocapt3 might want to debate
that, too.)

Mirel, beware the cat fights that occur from time to time over Hajime. :-D
The man has to be laughing his head off... wherever he is... and thinking he
was never so loved as he is in posterity.

phil (another MOST LOYAL fan of Saitou... meow)

-MissBehavin

wrote:
> Grace Battista <wounds@s...> wrote:
>
> >>I'm wounds the MOST LOYAL fan of Saitou-sama. <<
>
> With two websites devoted to Saitou alone (both of which are
determined to make me bald by the end of the week with all the hair-
pulling over format) and a fic site to SaitouxSano, I think you're
going to have to share that title, wounds. :-D MOST LOYAL... (I'm
sure secretarytocapt3 might want to debate that, too.)
>
I'm naturally selfish but I'll make an exception this time, since
Phil indeed beat me to creating a website for Saitou-sama... But
wait, Phil also cheats from time to time with Sano so... Wait I'm
still the THE MOST LOYAL FAN OF SAITOU-SAMA *grins devilishly*

As for Sec... I'll wait for her contension. *wounds stops and thinks*

Oh but wait! I called dibs to the title first so... NO SHARING...
MWAH! HAHAHAHAHA!


> Mirel, beware the cat fights that occur from time to time over
Hajime. :-D The man has to be laughing his head off... wherever he
is... and thinking he was never so loved as he is in posterity.
>
> phil (another MOST LOYAL fan of Saitou... meow)
>
Yes beware because ummm... Wait Mirel... Did you say your Saitou-sama
was your favorite... You wouldn't happen to be claiming the
title "Most Loyal" too would you? *winks*

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, Mirel <gryps_celsus@c...> wrote:
> Konnichi wa minna-san!
> I'm new here and I'm totally excited to finally get myself in this
group (I
> was having arguments with Yahoo about the existence of my
account). I am
> really interested in learning all I can about the Shinsengumi and
its
> members, and I've heard this is THE PLACE to get and share info in
English.
> Just as an intro, I'll give a quick rundown of what I'm into, ne?
Let's
> see, my fav. member is Saitou Hajime, although Peacemaker Kurogane
has
> gotten me quite curious about Harada Sanosuke as well. As for
anime, I've
> seen Kenshin and PMK and I am digging for more. In manga, I've
read a
> bunch of PMK and I have a bunch of scanlations sitting on my
computer
> waiting for attention. As for live action stuff, this is where I
am
> horribly deficient, but I hope to fix that soon!
> I've also taken two years of Japanese and would be going into my
3rd year
> if it weren't for the fact that I'm going to Tanzania this fall. I
love
> learning about other aspects Japanese history outside of the
Shinsengumi
> and the areas I'm most interested in include the Sengoku jidai (age
of
> civil wars), the Edo period, and the Meiji Restoration.
> Also, I'm currently working on a full Shinsengumi uniform (minus
the armor,
> because that would be really hard to make) to wear to this year's
Otakon in
> Baltimore, so any tips on such would be greatly appreciated.
>
> Well that's about it!
> I look forward to many more e-mails wrought with Shinsengumi
goodness!
>
> Tootles!
>

Just wanted to say WELCOME! Enjoy your stay... Don't worry about live-
action/chambara films you'll get there. TRUST ME.... Hmm what else?
Oh let me introduce myself to you, I'm wounds the MOST LOYAL fan of
Saitou-sama. I'm fond of the big three too, most specially Kondou but
with the new info I'm hearing that might change. *sigh*

See you around.

~wounds

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Hellos and First Impressions.
messages.msgSnippet: HELLO! -waves arms around like mad- I m MissBehavin, Hijikata-sama s biggest fan on the list! Saito-sama is my other obsession, but really I love ALL the guys.
messages.messageBody:
HELLO! -waves arms around like mad-

I'm MissBehavin, Hijikata-sama's biggest fan on the list! Saito-sama is my other obsession, but really I love ALL the guys. Welcome to the group! I can assure you that you'll find out everything you want to know about the boys in blue and white here...and then some!

Feel free to ask me if you're looking for something in particular and the mountain of old posts gets to you! This goes for all the newbies!

-MissBehavin

messages.subject: Re: Hellos and First Impressions.
messages.msgSnippet: Hey!  Someone I recognize from the LJ!!  (Not that there s anything going on over there at the moment.)  Glad you got things straightened out with Yahoo... I
messages.messageBody:
Hey! Someone I recognize from the LJ!! (Not that there's anything
going on over there at the moment.) Glad you got things straightened
out with Yahoo... I *know* how long THAT can take.

We've gots lots of Saitou fans and some PMK Harada fans. I'll let
past messages from Barb introduce you to the stylish-fundoshi version
of Harada from the live-action drama from NHK. :-D I'm just about
to get started watching some of that series. Lots of references to
film and television series featuring the Shinsengumi & the times...
unfortunatly buried in messages right now (unless someone has
compiled a film/tv list and posted it to Files?). If you get
confused like I do keeping them all straight, don't hesitate to ask
questions. Oh, and if you haven't already, consider signing up on
miburo so you can access the files that are over there. It's mostly
acting as storage space and full of info.
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/miburo .

So... Japanese language skills, eh? (very wicked grin, rubbing
hands... and not just me) Two years or three, you HAVE to be better
than babelfish... :-D

You don't have to have any translation skills to be welcome. We're
always glad to have more miburo fans to join the fun.

phil

messages.subject: Hellos and First Impressions.
messages.msgSnippet: Konnichi wa minna-san! I m new here and I m totally excited to finally get myself in this group (I was having arguments with Yahoo about the existence of my
messages.messageBody:
Konnichi wa minna-san!
I'm new here and I'm totally excited to finally get myself in this group (I
was having arguments with Yahoo about the existence of my account). I am
really interested in learning all I can about the Shinsengumi and its
members, and I've heard this is THE PLACE to get and share info in English.
Just as an intro, I'll give a quick rundown of what I'm into, ne? Let's
see, my fav. member is Saitou Hajime, although Peacemaker Kurogane has
gotten me quite curious about Harada Sanosuke as well. As for anime, I've
seen Kenshin and PMK and I am digging for more. In manga, I've read a
bunch of PMK and I have a bunch of scanlations sitting on my computer
waiting for attention. As for live action stuff, this is where I am
horribly deficient, but I hope to fix that soon!
I've also taken two years of Japanese and would be going into my 3rd year
if it weren't for the fact that I'm going to Tanzania this fall. I love
learning about other aspects Japanese history outside of the Shinsengumi
and the areas I'm most interested in include the Sengoku jidai (age of
civil wars), the Edo period, and the Meiji Restoration.
Also, I'm currently working on a full Shinsengumi uniform (minus the armor,
because that would be really hard to make) to wear to this year's Otakon in
Baltimore, so any tips on such would be greatly appreciated.

Well that's about it!
I look forward to many more e-mails wrought with Shinsengumi goodness!

Tootles!




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
